text: Cell - specific bifunctional role of Jun oncogene family members on glucocorticoid receptor - dependent transcription .

Interaction between protein kinase C ( PKC ) - and <extra_id_0> glucocorticoid receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) - mediated signaling is suggested by the ability of the PKC activating phorbol ester 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate ( TPA ) to inhibit <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent transcription of the mouse mammary tumor virus ( MMTV ) long terminal repeat ( LTR ) .

Here we report that this interference is cell specific , as TPA augmented dexamethasone - induced transcriptional activation of the MMTV LTR in several T cell lines but was inhibitory in NIH-3T3 fibroblasts .

TPA - <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> synergism was determined to have occurred at the <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - responsive element ( GRE ) level by functional analysis of deletion mutants or synthetic GRE oligonucleotides driving <extra_id_0> chloramphenicol acetyl-transferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .
Synergism required an intact <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> DNA - binding domain , whereas amino - or carboxyl-terminal domains were dispensable .
The effect was abrogated by the PKC inhibitor staurosporine , suggesting a role for PKC .

Increased <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> jun-B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> jun-D <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression above basal levels and increased transcriptional activity of AP-1 / TPA responsive elements fused to <extra_id_0> chloramphenicol acetyl-transferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> vectors were observed in T cells treated with TPA alone or in combination with dexamethasone .

text: We propose that Jun plays a bifunctional role on <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent transcriptional activation of GRE , selecting either synergistic or antagonistic activity depending on the cell - specific microenvironment .
In this regard , intracellular levels of <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> appear to be influential .
